TechManifesto.title: The Sovereign Source Manifesto
TechManifesto.subtitle: We are not just building software; we are building institutions. Our technical choices reflect our commitment to Haiti's autonomy, resilience, and dignity.

2g.title: 2G-First Design
2g.description: We optimize for the lowest common denominator of Haitian connectivity. If a page doesn't load on an Edge network in a rural communal section, it is a bug.

accountability.title: Professional Accountability
accountability.description: Every municipal official is linked to a verified Vwa profile, turning local governance into a professional career path.

sovereignty.title: Data Sovereignty
sovereignty.description: Built with BSL 1.1, this platform ensures that Haitian municipal data belongs to the municipality, not foreign commercial entities.

transparency.title: Transparency as Code
transparency.description: Audit logs and fee structures are baked into the UI, making corruption harder to hide and success easier to see.

footer.title: Built for Haiti. Owned by Haiti.
footer.description: This repository is available under the Business Source License 1.1, ensuring that while the code is open for distinct inspection, its commercial value remains sovereign to the Haitian people.

ImpactPage.title: Why This Matters
ImpactPage.subtitle: We are building the digital infrastructure for a new era of civic trust. Our platform empowers citizens and officials to work together through four core pillars.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.description: Real-time visibility into infrastructure funds. Every gourde collected and spent is tracked on a public open ledger, eliminating the shadows where corruption hides.

accountability.title: Accountability
accountability.description: Direct reporting loops. When a citizen reports a pothole or missing trash pickup, it goes directly to the dashboard of the responsible CASEC, creating a verifiable record of action (or inaction).

digital.title: Digital Transformation
digital.description: Moving from paper to pixels. We are replacing fragile physiocal ledgers with decentralized, cloud-backed mobile databases that survive floods, fires, and political transitions.

data.title: Data Access
data.description: A Single Source of Truth. Whether it's birth certificate procedures or school locations, citizens shouldn't have to rely on rumors. We provide official, verified municipal data.

leadership.title: A New Standard for Leadership
leadership.desc1: We aren't just tracking projects; we are documenting the professional legacy of the people building Haiti.
leadership.desc2: Through our partnership with Vwa, every Mayor, ASEC, and CASEC gets a verified professional profile. This allows citizens to see their track record, past roles, and verified achievements—creating a permanent history of service.
leadership.partnerSubtitle: The definitive verification platform for Haitian professionals.

birthCertificates.title: Archives & Birth Certificates
birthCertificates.description: Requesting an 'Extrait d'Archives' is a critical step for legal identification, passports, and school enrollment. We help facilitate the request between your local Mairie and the National Archives in Port-au-Prince.
steps: Visit the Mairie (City Hall) with your birth notice or an old extract copy.
Fill out the 'Demande d'Extrait' form provided by the civil registry officer.
The Mairie will transmit your request to the National Archives (ANH).
Once the extract is returned to the Mairie, you will be notified via SMS or phone.
Pick up your official document at the City Hall office.
documents: Copy of original birth notice (Acte de Naissance/Déclaration)
National ID (CIN) of the person making the request
Power of attorney (if requesting for someone else)
birthCertificates.fees: The standard fee for a birth certificate extract is 500 HTG. Expedited processing may incur additional municipal charges.

governance.title: How Your Local Government Works
governance.intro: In Haiti, local governance is decentralized into "Communes" and "Communal Sections." Understanding who does what helps you get the right services and hold your representatives accountable.

mairie.title: The Municipal Council (Mairie)
mairie.description: Led by a **Principal Mayor** and two Deputy Mayors, the municipal council manages the entire city (Commune). They oversee urban planning, tax collection, public safety, and major infrastructure projects.

list.label: **Leadership:** Principal Mayor and two Deputy Mayors.
**Responsibilities:** Urban planning, tax collection, and major infrastructure.

casec.title: CASEC (Executive Council)
casec.description: The **Administrative Council of the Communal Section (CASEC)** is a 3-member executive team elected to manage a specific rural or urban section of the city.

list.label: **Executive Authority:** They execute the budget and manage small local projects (wells, local roads, sanitation).
**Public Record:** They can verify documents and provide certifications for residents in their section.
**Mediation:** Often acting as first-responders for local disputes and social harmony.

asec.title: ASEC (Assembly)
asec.description: The **Assembly of the Communal Section (ASEC)** is a deliberative body of 7 to 11 members. While CASEC is the "executive," ASEC is the "checks and balances."

list.label: **Oversight:** They approve the local development plan and oversee CASEC's spending.
**Representation:** They represent the voice of the specific neighborhoods within the section.
**Policy:** They debate and vote on local guidelines for land use and community resources.

delegates.title: Town Delegates
delegates.description: Town Delegates (Délégués de Ville) are administrative assistants appointed to bridge the gap between specific city neighborhoods and the central Mairie office.

list.label: **Liaison:** Linking neighborhoods directly to the Mayor's office.
**Administration:** Assisting in coordinating municipal services at a street level.
**Representation:** Ensuring local neighborhood needs are heard centrally.

footer.ctaText: Get to know your specific representatives and start a conversation today using our directory.

cleanup.title: Street Cleanup
cleanup.description: We are dedicated to keeping our boulevards and public spaces clean. Report illegal dumping or request sweeping for major events.
steps: Identify the location of the litter or illegal dump.
Take a photo if possible (safe to do so).
Submit a report using the 'Report Street Litter' button below.
A sanitation team will be dispatched within 48-72 hours.
documents: For event cleanup requests: Event Permit Number.
cleanup.fees: Reporting illegal dumping is free. Event cleanup services start at 5,000 HTG.

reports.title: See Trash or Debris?
reports.description: Help us keep the city clean by reporting large piles of trash, construction debris, or dead animals.

culture.title: Culture & Tourism
culture.description: Our city is rich in history and vibrant traditions. From Carnival to patron saint festivals, the Culture Department ensures our heritage is preserved and celebrated.
steps: Apply for event permits at least 30 days in advance.
Register new cultural organizations with the Town Hall.
Visit the 'Directory' to find museums and historical sites.
Follow our official channels for live event streams.
culture.fees: Public park usage fees vary by event size. Standard cultural registration is free.

youtube.title: Watch Live Events
youtube.description: Missed a festival or town hall meeting? We stream key cultural events and announcements on our official YouTube channel.

towing.title: Towing & Impounds
towing.description: The municipality enforces parking regulations to keep streets clear and safe. If your vehicle has been towed, use this service to locate it and understand the reclamation process.
steps: Enter your license plate number below to check if your vehicle is in a municipal lot.
Visit the specific impound lot listed in your search result.
Present valid ID, Vehicle Registration, and Insurance.
Pay the towing and storage fees (Cash or certified check).
towing.fees: Towing Fee: 3,500 HTG. Storage Fee: 500 HTG/day (First 24 hours free).
